Package seprhou.logic

The internal game logic.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AirspaceObjectFactory
    Interface which is responsible for creating all the new aircraft in the game
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Aircraft
    An aircraft in the airspace
    Airspace
    Controls an entire air space and all the aircraft in it
    AirspaceObject
    An object residing in the airspace (which can move and collide with things)
    CollisionWarning
    A warning that two aircraft are "close" to each other
    FlightPlan
    Class which stores the flight plan of an aircraft and its initial trajectory
    FlightPlanGenerator
    The default flight plan generator which controls introducing aircraft into the game
    Rectangle
    An immutable, mathematical 2D vector class
    Utils
    Various utility functions
    Vector2D
    An immutable, mathematical 2D vector class

Package seprhou.logic Description

The internal game logic.

Here is a brief summary of the most important classes in this package.

Airspace

The Airspace class is at the root of the game logic model. It contains the list of active aircraft and handles collisions and updating of the game environment. Generally you would run Airspace.refresh(float) every game tick and then use the other methods to get data which you can use to draw the game environment.

AirspaceObject and Aircraft

The AirspaceObject and Aircraft objects live in an airspace and can move around by setting a target velocity and a target altitude. Motion and collisions are controlled in the AirspaceObject (so you can apply those aspects to other objects). The flight plan and waypoints are handled by the Aircraft object.

AirspaceObjectFactory

The AirspaceObjectFactory interface is used by the Airspace class to introduce new aircraft into the airspace. Each time it is called, you have the option of returning a new aircraft (or any subclass of AirspaceObject).

FlightPlanGenerator

The FlightPlanGenerator is an optional class which can generate flight plans according to some configuration options. Generally you would ask this class to create a flightplan in your implementation of AirspaceObjectFactory.
